unnormalised: ## Builder Reviews: Are they REALLY reliable? (Real Estate & Property)
normalised: ## Builder Reviews: Are they REALLY reliable? (Real Estate and Property)

unnormalised: So, I'm finally taking the plunge and looking to buy a flat in Mumbai. Of course, the first thing I did was Google "best builders in Mumbai" and got bombarded with sites full of builder reviews. But honestly, how much can we *really* trust these things?
normalised: So, I'm finally taking the plunge and looking to buy a flat in Mumbai. Of course, the first thing I did was Google "best builders in Mumbai" and got bombarded with sites full of builder reviews. But honestly, how much can we *really* trust these things?

unnormalised: I’ve seen some glowing reviews for builders like Lodha and Godrej, but then I dig a little deeper and find comments questioning the build quality after a few years (like water leakage after the monsoon in Navi Mumbai – nightmare!). I even saw one where a user alleged the promised amenities weren't delivered even after 2 years.
normalised: I’ve seen some glowing reviews for builders like Lodha and Godrej, but then I dig a little deeper and find comments questioning the build quality after a few years (like water leakage after the monsoon in Navi Mumbai – nightmare!). I even saw one where a user alleged the promised amenities weren't delivered even after two years.

unnormalised: Anyone else feel like it's hard to sift through the genuine opinions and potential paid promotions? I remember my uncle bought a flat back in 2010 from a relatively unknown builder based on 'amazing' reviews, and he's still dealing with issues related to possession and maintenance. He tells me 'buyer beware' is the mantra!
normalised: Anyone else feel like it's hard to sift through the genuine opinions and potential paid promotions? I remember my uncle bought a flat back in two thousand and ten from a relatively unknown builder based on 'amazing' reviews, and he's still dealing with issues related to possession and maintenance. He tells me 'buyer beware' is the mantra!

unnormalised: I'm specifically looking at properties near Powai. Any personal experiences or insights on builders operating in that area would be greatly appreciated! Perhaps someone can share experiences dealing with challenges like RERA compliance and timely possession around 17/06/2023? Or maybe even details on handover rituals carried out by various developers?
normalised: I'm specifically looking at properties near Powai. Any personal experiences or insights on builders operating in that area would be greatly appreciated! Perhaps someone can share experiences dealing with challenges like R E R A compliance and timely possession around seventeenth June two thousand and twenty three? Or maybe even details on handover rituals carried out by various developers?

unnormalised: Has anyone tried verifying reviews by physically visiting older projects of the builder, perhaps around 11:00 hrs on a weekday? Also, is it wise to rely solely on websites and forums, or is it better to connect with existing residents via local community groups before finalizing anything on 26/01/2024?
normalised: Has anyone tried verifying reviews by physically visiting older projects of the builder, perhaps around eleven hundred hours on a weekday? Also, is it wise to rely solely on websites and forums, or is it better to connect with existing residents via local community groups before finalizing anything on twenty sixth January two thousand and twenty four?

unnormalised: I'm looking to invest around Rs. 1.5 Cr, so I want to be absolutely sure I’m making the right decision. Any advice would be a great help!
normalised: I'm looking to invest around rupee one point five crore, so I want to be absolutely sure I’m making the right decision. Any advice would be a great help!
